title.narrative: Nigeria Erosion and Watershed Management Project

description.narrative: To reduce vulnerability to soil erosion in targeted sub-watersheds.

participating-org.narrative: National Project Implementation Unit, Federal Ministry of Environment

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Annual Work Plans and Budget Financing Agreement: Section I.F, Schedule 2 | Description :Preparation of annualwork plans and budget | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Computerized Financial Management System Financing Agreement: Section II.B.4, Schedule | Description :Obligationof the Borrower to install - and to cause each participating state to install – a computerized financial management system | DueDate :30-Jan-2013
Finance Agreement :Disbursement Financing Agreement: Section IV, Schedule 2 | Description :Withdrawal schedule with categories ofeligible expenditures | Frequency :Monthly

Finance Agreement :Effectiveness Conditions Financing Agreement: Sections 4.01 & 4.03 | Description :At least one subsidiaryagreement with a participating state executed; provision for cross-effectiveness of IDA Financing Agreement and GEF & SCCF GrantAgreements; adoption of satisfactory Project Implementation Manual; and establishment of a procurement tracking and filing systemby the Borrower | Due Date :06-Nov-2012

Finance Agreement :Environmental and Social Safeguards Financing Agreement: Section II.G, Schedule 2 | Description :Obligation toimplement the project in accordance with the ESMF and RPF for the Project, including the preparation of ESMPs and RAPs as requiredunder the ESMF and RPF | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Financial Management/ Audit Arrangements Financing Agreement: Section III.B, Schedule | Description :Standardfinancial management covenants, including obligation to submit interim financial reports and annual project audits | Frequency:Quarterly
Finance Agreement :Independent FM Auditor Financing Agreement: Section II.B.5 | Description :Appointment of independent auditorsfor FM | Due Date :30-Jun-2014

Finance Agreement :Institutional Arrangements Financing Agreement: Section I.A, Schedule 2 | Description :Provisions requiring themaintenance of relevant Project management structures at federal, state, LGA and community level, i.e. federal and state steeringcommittees and technical committees, project management units within the federal and state ministries of environment, federal andstate financial management divisions, local government authorities and site committees | Due Date :06-Nov-2012
Finance Agreement :Procurement Audits Financing Agreement: Section III.F, Schedule 2 | Description :Procurement and technicalaudits by independent auditors | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Procurement Complaints Management System Financing Agreement: Section III.E, Schedule | Description:Establishment of a procurement complaints management system at federal and state levels | Due Date :30-Jun-2014

Finance Agreement :Project Implementation Manual Financing Agreement: Section II.E, Schedule 2 | Description :Obligation to carryout the project in accordance with a project implementation manual satisfactory to the Bank | Due Date :06-Nov-2012
Finance Agreement :Project Progress Report Financing Agreement: Section II.A, Schedule 2 | Description :Preparation of projectprogress report | Frequency :Quarterly

Finance Agreement :State Procurement Filing and Tracking System Financing Agreement: Section III.E, | Description :Establishment ofa procurement filing and tracking system for each participating state | Due Date :30-Jan-2013

Finance Agreement :Subsidiary Agreements Financing Agreement: Section I.C, Schedule 2 | Description :Obligation to executesubsidiary agreements between the Borrower and the participating states, on terms and conditions satisfactory to the Bank | DueDate :06-Nov-2012

title.narrative: Spatial Knowledge Management Information System on erosion and watersheds operational
Upgraded and newly installed stations providing data for integrated catchment planning
People receiving project-supported advisory support services in integrated land/water management practices, planning, and/or monitoring under the Project (of which 40% female)
Area under bio-remediation in targeted sub-watersheds
EIA guidelines developed for targeted investment types that affect erosion (road cross drainage, urban water supply and drainage)
Reports produced on project progress at federal and state levels
Land area under sustainable landscape management practices
Targeted land treated for erosion with selected measures in targeted sub-watersheds
Households benefitting from livelihoods enhancement activities under the Project (of which 40% female)
Climate adaptation /low carbon demonstration projects completed
Targeted gully complexes and other erosion sites treated with 100% of planned measures for targeted sub-watersheds
Participatory sub-watershed Management plans developed under the project for targeted erosion affected sub-watersheds
Technical reports/ guidelines on promoting low carbon development or enhancing climate resilience completed
Targeted gully complexes and other erosion sites with reduced severity level after treatment
City storm water master plans developed which are informed by climate projections of increased rainfall intensity and risk assessments
States with improved erosion risk mapping
Development and Issuing of Green Bond Phases
National Centers of Excellence in erosion control established, operational and functional
Packages with detailed design for treatment of gully complexes and erosion sites in targeted subwatersheds prepared under the project that have received WBG No-Objection but not financed by NEWMAP
Community Interest Group collecting municipal solid waste in project intervention areas
